{{italic title}} {{Infobox book <!-- |italic title = (see above) --> | name = The Lemberg Mosaic | image = File:Lemberg mosaic, front cover.jpg | border = yes | caption = Cover Art | title_orig = Memoirs of Two who Survived the Destruction of Jewish Galicia | orig_lang_code = en | title_working = | translator = | author = Jakob Weiss | country = United States | language = English | subject = The Holocaust | genre = Non-fiction | publisher = Alderbrook Press | publisher2 = | pub_date = First Edition 2010 | pages = 417 | awards = | isbn = 9780983109105 | oclc = 711128993 | dewey = | congress = }} '''''The Lemberg Mosaic''''', subtitled the "Memoirs of Two who Survived the Destruction of Jewish Galicia," is a book on the [[Holocaust]] by Jakob Weiss.<ref>Published in paperback and hardcover format February, 2011 by Alderbrook Press (New York). The copyright page indicates a first printing on November 15, 2010.</ref> This work brings to light the relatively obscure history of the systematic and total destruction of Jewish [[Lemberg]] (Lwów, now [[Lviv]] in [[Ukraine]]). It is presented in the format of a biography,<ref name="WorldCat">{{worldcat|oclc=711128993}}</ref> detailing the struggle for survival of four families in the backdrop of two back-to-back invasions of the city and surrounding region by both the Soviets (1939) and the Germans (1941).
==Overview== Before the Second World War Lviv was known as [[Lwów]]. After the [[Treaty of Versailles]] and the rebirth of modern Poland (the [[Second Polish Republic]]), Lwów (formerly, Lemberg) became the third largest city in Poland with the third largest Jewish population (after [[Warsaw]] and [[Lódz]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishbookcouncil.org/book/the-lemberg-mosaic-the-memoirs-of-two-who-survived-the-destruction-of-jewish-galicia |title=The Lemberg Mosaic: The Memoirs of Two Who Survived the Destruction of Jewish Galicia |publisher=Jewishbookcouncil.org |date= |accessdate=2012-03-19}}</ref> Some sources call the destruction of this once vibrant Jewish community the "Holocaust by Bullets,"<ref>Desbois, Father Patrick, ''The Holocaust by Bullets: A Priest's Journey to Uncover the Truth Behind the Murder of 1.5 Million Jews'' MacMillan (2008)</ref> or the "[[Shoah]] of Jewish Galicia" or the "Ukrainian Holocaust." Recent forensic evidence as uncovered and analyzed by researchers like the French priest, Father Patrick Desbois, has coroborated the testimony of both survivors and eyewitnesses that well over one million and perhaps as many as 1.5 million Jews were brutally murdered in World War II during the Nazi invasion of the eastern-most region of Poland, also known as [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]], today's [[West Ukraine]].<ref>Desbois, Father Patrick, ''The Holocaust by Bullets</ref>
==Afterward by Dr. Berthold Zarwyn== [[File:Lemberg_mosaic,_back_cover_image.jpg|thumb|upright|Back cover art: ''Collage'']] The book's Afterword was penned by [http://bios.marquiswhoswho.com/berthold_zarwyn/physicist_consultant/6463768 Dr. Berthold Zarwyn] himself a native of the city and survivor of the [[Lwow ghetto|Lemberg ghetto]]. In it, he details his own eyewitness account of what transpired during the Nazi invasion, including participation of the [[Ukrainian People's Militia|Ukrainian militia]], the [[Ukrainian Auxiliary Police]] and the local populace in the atrocities - primarily targeting the Jews in the city and the surrounding region of eastern Galicia ([[District of Galicia]]). In his comments, a cross reference is made by Dr. Zarwyn to a specific Ukrainian auxiliary police officer, [[John Kalymon]] who was stripped of his United States citizenship for falsifying his role as a guard in the Lemberg Ghetto.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://articles.cnn.com/2011-09-20/us/us_michigan-ukrainian-nazi_1_eli-rosenbaum-ukrainian-auxiliary-police-labor-camps?_s=PM:US |title=Former Ukrainian Nazi, 90, loses deportation appeal in Michigan - CNN |publisher=Articles.cnn.com |date=2011-09-20 |accessdate=2012-03-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111228204637/http://articles.cnn.com/2011-09-20/us/us_michigan-ukrainian-nazi_1_eli-rosenbaum-ukrainian-auxiliary-police-labor-camps?_s=PM:US |archivedate=2011-12-28 |df= }}</ref> Dr. Zarwyn has made a significant contribution to the continuing efforts to bring former Nazi collaborators to justice such as Kalymon who is currently the subject of a criminal prosection by a Munich tribunal as [[Operation Last Chance]] continues. The Munich prosecution of Kalymon is now before same court (led by the same prosecutor) that tried and convicted the infamous [[John Demjanjuk]] as an accessory to the murder of 27,900 Jews.

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} This is a '''[[Timeline of the 2006 Lebanon War|timeline]] of the [[2006 Lebanon War]]''' during the month of July.
==12 July==
{{main|Zar'it-Shtula incident}} {| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''[[Hezbollah]]''' *At about 9 a.m. local time [[Hezbollah]] launched [[Katyusha rocket launcher|Katyusha]] rockets across the Lebanese border with Israel as a [[Feint|diversionary tactic]], targeting the town of [[Shlomi, Israel|Shlomi]] and outposts in the [[Shebaa Farms]] area. At the same time Hezbollah's military wing staged a cross-border attack in northern Israel on two Israeli [[Humvee]]s. Three Israeli soldiers were killed, two wounded, and two were captured and taken into Lebanon.<ref>{{cite news |title=Report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (For the period from 21 January 2006 to 18 July 2006) |date=21 July 2006 |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] |url=http://domino.un.org/unispal.NSF/fd807e46661e3689852570d00069e918/87e2508779d8ec83852571b6004c761f |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150107080734/http://domino.un.org/unispal.NSF/fd807e46661e3689852570d00069e918/87e2508779d8ec83852571b6004c761f |archivedate=7 January 2015 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref name="bbc-1">{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5179434.stm|title=Day-by-day: Lebanon crisis – week one|publisher=BBC|date=19 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-23}}</ref>
*[[Hezbollah]] claimed its objective is "to free 10,000 Arabs captured by Israel".<ref name="bbc-1" />"Fulfilling its pledge to liberate the Arab prisoners and detainees, the Islamic Resistance... captured two Israeli soldiers ([[Ehud Goldwasser]] and [[Eldad Regev]]) at the border with occupied [[State of Palestine|Palestine]]", Hezbollah said in a statement.<ref name="hrz-1">{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738310.html|title=IDF retrieves bodies of four tank soldiers killed in south Lebanon|work=[[Haaretz]]|date=14 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-16}}</ref> * [[Hezbollah]]'s attacks draw international condemnation. The United States, [[European Union]], Japan, UK, Egypt and UN call for the immediate unconditional release of two kidnapped Israeli soldiers. The [[Politics of Syria|Syrian government]] and [[Hamas]] praise the attack by Hezbollah.<ref name="haaretz.com">[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/pages/ShArt.jhtml?itemNo=737755 (Haaretz)]</ref><ref name="Jerusalem Post">[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1150885984018&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull (Jerusalem Post)]</ref> |- |'''Lebanon''' *Lebanese Ambassador to the U.S. [[Farid Abboud]] was recalled to Beriut following controversial comments in support of Hezbollah made on CNN.<ref name="haaretz.com"/><ref name="Jerusalem Post"/> Officials in Beirut claimed that Abboud's view had not represent that of Lebanon, which is opposed to Hezbollah's actions on Israel's northern border.<ref>{{cite web |title=Harvard Journal of Law & Public Policy |url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/middle_east/july-dec06/israel_07-12.html |accessdate=2007-08-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140115164420/http://www.pbs.org/newshour/bb/middle_east/july-dec06/israel_07-12.html |archivedate=15 January 2014 }}</ref> |- |'''United States''' *The United States condemned what they call Hezbollah's "unprovoked act of terrorism" by saying: "Today Hezbollah terrorists operating from Lebanon kidnapped two Israeli soldiers and launched rocket attacks against civilian targets in Israel. The United States condemns in the strongest terms this unprovoked act of terrorism, which was timed to exacerbate already high tensions in the region and sow further violence. We also hold Syria and Iran, which have provided long-standing support for Hezbollah, responsible for today's violence. We call for the immediate and unconditional release of the Israeli soldiers." * The United States blame Syria and Iran for the kidnapping of the two Israeli soldiers.<ref>[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,203166,00.html (Fox News)]</ref><ref>[http://today.reuters.com/news/newsarticle.aspx?type=politicsNews&storyid=2006-07-12T180458Z_01_LA622138_RTRUKOC_0_US-MIDEAST-USA-KIDNAPPINGS.xml&src=rss&rpc=22 (Reuters)]</ref>
|- |'''Israel''' * In attempt to pursue the Hezbollah force and release the captured soldiers, an Israeli [[Merkava|Merkava Mark II]] tank was hit by a 200–300 kilogram mine. All 4 crew members were killed.<ref name="hrz-1"/> In an attempt to recover the bodies of the soldiers from the burnt tank, another Israeli soldier was hit by Hezbollah fire and killed. * Israel files a complaint with the [[UN Security Council]] and UN Secretary General [[Kofi Annan]], urging the international community to enforce [[UN Security Council Resolution 1559|council resolutions]] calling on the Lebanese government to disarm all militias within its borders and to extend its authority throughout its territory and specifically to southern Lebanon and its border with Israel.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/pages/ShArt.jhtml?itemNo=737687 (Haaretz)]</ref> * Israel retaliated by ground, air and sea attacks. In addition to air strikes on Hezbollah positions, the IDF targeted numerous roads and bridges in southern Lebanon.<ref>{{cite news | title=Lebanon – UNIFIL – Background | accessdate=2006-09-22 | publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] | url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/background.html | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060716184118/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/background.html | archivedate=16 July 2006 | df=dmy-all }}</ref> At least 12 bridges were hit, one Lebanese civilian<ref>ynet.co.il</ref> as well as one Hezbollah fighter were killed.<ref>{{cite news | title= Israel battles militants on two fronts | date=12 July 2006 | agency=Reuters | url=http://today.reuters.com/news/articlenews.aspx?type=topNews&storyid=2006-07-13T005819Z_01_L11538533_RTRUKOC_0_US-MIDEAST.xml&src=rss}}</ref> An [[Israel Defense Forces#Reserve service|IDF reserve]] armoured [[Division (military)|division]] is called up in preparation for large scale operations in Lebanon, raising concerns for war.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/737634.html (Haaretz)]</ref> * Israeli Prime MinisterEhud Olmert]] describes the [[2006 Lebanon war#Hezbollah action|Hezbollah attacks]] as "unjustified acts of war" by Lebanon and promises a "very painful and far-reaching [[2006 Lebanon war|response]]".<ref>[http://today.reuters.com/news/newsArticle.aspx?type=worldNews&storyID=2006-07-12T115735Z_01_L11538533_RTRUKOC_0_US-MIDEAST.xml (Reuters)]{{dead link|date=December 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>[http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/L/LEBANON_ISRAEL_CLASH?SITE=WIJAN&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&SECTION=HOME (Associated Press)]</ref>
|}
==13 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''Israel''' *Impose blockade on Lebanon. |- |'''Israel''' *Israel imposes an air and sea [[blockade]] on Lebanon. Israeli fighters attack the [[Beirut]]–[[Damascus]] Highway, closing the country's main artery and further isolating Lebanon from the outside world.<ref>[http://www.seattlepi.com/national/1107AP_Lebanon_Israel_Highway.html (''Seattle Post-Intelligencer'')]</ref><ref>[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,203253,00.html (Fox)]</ref> *Attack at 7:45 on Beirut's [[Rafic Hariri International Airport]] – two main runways damaged. *Attack on Rayak Air Base in the [[Bekaa Valley]] near the Syrian border, destroying runways, the first attack against Lebanon's army in the 2006 Lebanon war.<ref>[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,203253,00.html (Fox News)]</ref><ref>[http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1150885985413&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull (''Jerusalem Post'')] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110916122533/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1150885985413&pagename=JPost%2FJPArticle%2FShowFull |date=16 September 2011 }}</ref> *Attack [[Rene Mouawad Air Base|small military airport in Qulayaat]] in northern Lebanon. *Israel destroys [[Hezbollah]] headquarters and home of its head [[Hassan Nasrallah]] in southern [[Beirut]], following repeated early warnings to local civilians. * Some 220,000 Israeli civilians spend the night in bomb shelters, after two civilians were killed in rocket attacks. 14 Israelis, including 4 children, remain hospitalized following yesterday's rocket attacks.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/pages/ShArt.jhtml?itemNo=738632 (Haaretz)]</ref><ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/Ext/Comp/CdaNewsFlash/0,2297,L-3275530_3089,00.html (Ynet)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071122043409/http://www.ynetnews.com/Ext/Comp/CdaNewsFlash/0%2C2297%2CL-3275530_3089%2C00.html |date=22 November 2007 }}</ref> |- |'''Hezbollah''' * Hezbollah bombarded the Israeli towns of [[Nahariya]] and [[Safed]] as well as villages nearby, with about 90 [[9K51 Grad]] rockets. The attacks killed two civilians and wounded 29 more.<ref>{{cite news|title=Woman killed in Hizbullah attack in Nahariya|date=13 July 2006|work=[[Jerusalem Post]]|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1150885985131&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120708205443/http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1150885985131&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|archivedate=8 July 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref> *Nasrallah vows to fight "open war" on Israel, striking towns "beyond Haifa".<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/pages/ShArt.jhtml?itemNo=738611 (Haaretz)]</ref><ref>[http://www.boston.com/news/world/middleeast/articles/2006/07/14/israel_strikes_beirut_suburb_1152852238/ (Boston Globe)]</ref><ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5182048.stm (BBC NEWS)]</ref> * [[Haifa]] city is hit by [[Fajr-3#Fajr-3 Artillery Rocket|rocket artillery]] fired from Lebanon. Israeli Ambassador to the United States Daniel Ayalon describes the unprecedented strike on Haifa as a "major, major escalation" by [[Hezbollah]].<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738318.html (Haaretz)]</ref><ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3275229,00.html (Ynet)]</ref> |- |'''Lebanon''' *Lebanon announces its refusal to abide [[UN Security Council]]'s Resolutions [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1559|1559]] and [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1583|1583]], calling Lebanon to assert full control over its border with Israel.<ref name="ReferenceA">[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738315.html (Haaretz)]</ref> |}
== 14 July ==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''Hezbollah''' * Fired dozens of [[Katyusha rocket launcher|Katyusha]] rockets into [[northern Israel]] reaching [[Haifa]]. * Fired two Iranian built [[C-701]] Cruise Missiles of Chinese design – one damages an Israeli [[Sa'ar 5-class missile boat]], the [[INS Hanit]], killing four crew members. The other missile damages a civilian vessel of Egyptian registry. It is later debated whether Hezbollah or Iranian military personnel fired the cruise missiles. * [[Hezbollah]] leader [[Hassan Nasrallah]] said that Hezbollah is ready for "open war" with Israel. |- |'''Iran''' * [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]], the president of Iran, warned Israel of a "fierce response" if it attacks Syria. |- |'''Syria''' * The ruling party in Syria, [[Baath Party|Baath]], said that Syria fully backs [[Hezbollah]] against the "barbaric Israeli aggression". |- |'''United States''' * US President [[George W. Bush]] has said he will urge Israel to avoid civilian casualties in its attacks on Lebanon, but he's "not going to make military decisions for Israel". [http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738183.html (Haaretz)], [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5180862.stm (BBC NEWS)]. |- |'''IDF''' [[File:Lebmap02.jpg|200px|thumb|right|Map of conflict as of 14 July 2006. In yellow is the Israeli blockade, in the red area regions of active conflict.]] * Bombs the airport road in the south of the capital, [[Beirut]]. * Drops leaflets warning residents to stay away from the Hezbollah offices in southern Beirut, where Hezbollah leader Sheik [[Hassan Nasrallah]] is thought to live. * Bombs the main highway between Beirut and the Syrian capital of [[Damascus]]. * Attacked the [[al-Manar]] television station. A broadcast tower was destroyed and three people were injured, but the station continued its broadcasts. * Warships set up a blockade, preventing cruise ships from docking in Beirut and cutting off the delivery of fuel used to operate Lebanese power plants. * Airstrikes and artillery shelling of hundreds of targets in Lebanon. * Strikes the Beirut airport, where helicopter gunships damaged runways and destroyed fuel tanks. *Bombs the [[Jiyeh power station oil spill|Jiyeh power station]] '''Israel''' * Israeli prime minister [[Ehud Olmert]] outlined three conditions for the Israeli operation to end: full implementation of [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1559]] calling for the disarming of [[Hezbollah]], an end to rocket attacks from Lebanon on Israeli towns, and the return of the two abducted soldiers.<ref name="cnn-1" >{{cite news|title=Olmert orders new Lebanon strikes|date=14 July 2006|publisher=BBC|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5179862.stm}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Ahmadinejad: Israel would not dare to move against Iran|date=14 July 2006|work=[[Haaretz]]|url=http://www.haaretz.co.il/hasen/spages/738315.html|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060719232929/http://www.haaretz.co.il/hasen/spages/738315.html|archivedate=19 July 2006|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://today.reuters.co.uk/news/newsArticle.aspx?type=topNews&storyID=2006-07-14T231853Z_01_L14613120_RTRUKOC_0_UK-MIDEAST-SYRIA-HIZBOLLAH.xml|title=Syria says fully backs Hizbollah against Israel|date=15 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-15|agency=Reuters}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }}</ref> |}
==15 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''IDF''' *Warships bombard Beirut's lighthouse and four ports.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://today.reuters.co.uk/tv/videoStory.aspx?isSummitStory=False&storyId=52817959aa6c6cc9afd98078e18ac650f1de6764&WTmodLoc=NewsArt-R3-RelatedNews-8|title=Israel continues bombing|agency=Reuters|date=15 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-16}}</ref> *Air force fired a missile at a van in [[southern Lebanon]], killing 20 people, among them 15 children.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nyhetsindex.se/Reuters__International/2006/07/16/Israel_kills_35_civilians_in_strikes_on_Lebanon|title=Israel kills 35 civilians in strikes on Lebanon|agency=Reuters|date=15 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-16}}</ref> *Raids on north, east and south Lebanon killed 15 people and wounded 37. *Lebanon's main commercial ports of [[Beirut]] and [[Tripoli, Lebanon|Tripoli]] were attacked, as well as ports in the Christian towns of [[Jounieh]] and [[Amsheet]]. *One Lebanese soldier was killed when an army radar station was hit in [[Batroun]] north of Beirut. *Warplanes flattened Hezbollah's nine-story headquarters and destroyed the office of a Hamas leader, [[Mohammed Nazzal]]. Nazzal survived the attack. *Israeli navy gunships bombarded an electric power station on the coast at [[Jiyeh power station oil spill|Jiyeh power station]], about 25 km south of Beirut.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://heraldsun.news.com.au/common/story_page/0,5478,19785528%255E1702,00.html|title=Beirut power station bombed|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]|date=14 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-16}}</ref> *[[Israel Air Force]] strikes [[Hezbollah]] targets and facilities in Lebanon. An Israeli general says all Lebanese coastal [[radar]]s were destroyed, after they took part in the attack on an Israeli [[INS Hanit|missile boat]] on Friday, killing 4 soldiers. |- |'''Artists''' *Lebanese artist Mazen Kerbaj took his trumpet to his apartment's balcony and recorded an improvisational duet with the Israeli military force. Later, he titled this sound piece "Starry Night."[http://mazenkerblog.blogspot.com] |- |'''Hezbollah''' *Fires 20 rockets into Haifa, killing 8 and wounding 20. 10 rockets also fired into Tiberius for the first time, forcing many displaced Israeli civilians who came to the city for shelter from northern cities farther south – total of more than a hundred [[Katyusha rocket launcher|Katyusha]]. Israeli defense minister [[Amir Peretz]] is about to sign a "home front emergency" declaration, enabling local security forces to shut down schools and close certain areas for traffic, narrowing the damages of the expanding fighting.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738632.html (Haaretz)], [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3276176,00.html (Ynet)]</ref> |- |'''United Nations''' *[[United Nations Security Council]] turns down for now a Lebanese request to impose a cease-fire. Israeli Prime Minister [[Ehud Olmert]] told [[UN Secretary-General]] [[Kofi Annan]] that Israel would not end its military operation in Lebanon until the implementation of [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 1559|UNSC Resolution 1559]], which calls for disarming [[Hezbollah]] and the deployment of the Lebanese army in southern Lebanon. [http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738671.html (Haaretz)], [http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/n/a/2006/07/14/national/w130201D34.DTL (SF Gate)] |- |'''United States''' * US President [[George W. Bush]] calls for Syria to urge [[Hezbollah]] to "lay down its arms and to stop attacking". [[Russian Federation|Russian]] defense minister [[Sergei Ivanov]] calls Hezbollah to "cease using terrorist methods, including attacks on neighboring countries".<ref name="ReferenceA"/> * The presidents of the United States and Russia differ in emphasis in voicing concern about the Lebnanon crisis at the [[32nd G8 summit]] in [[Strelna]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/5182730.stm (BBC)]</ref> |}
==16 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''Hezbollah''' *[[Nazareth]] and [[Afula]] are hit by Hezbollah rockets, reaching the deepest of all rockets fired by the militant group.<ref name="Hezbollah Rockets Reach Deeper Into Israel">{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,203851,00.html|title=Hezbollah Rockets Reach Deeper into Israel | work=Fox News | date=16 July 2006}}</ref> *[[Hezbollah]] rockets hit the major Israeli city of [[Haifa]], killing 8 civilians and wounding 17. Local train lines and universities closed down.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738747.html (Haaretz)], [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5184428.stm (BBC)], [http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/9E89DE1C-45C9-48D6-A5C3-6F15C9C29692.htm (Al-Jazeera)], [http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2006/07/14/world/main1804389.shtml (CBS)], [http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1150886006292&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull (Jerusalem post)]</ref> |- |'''Israel''' *Israel increases the alert level in [[Tel Aviv]] in preparation to further attacks.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738747.html (Haaretz)], [http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/L16654109.htm (Reuters)]</ref>
'''IDF''' *Lebanon security officials claim that an Israeli air strike on [[Tyre, Lebanon|Tyre]] kills at least 16 people and wounds 42.<ref>[http://www.tribstar.com/news/feeds/apcontent/apstories/apstorysection/D8IT7IF00.xml.txt/resources_apstoryview (AP)], [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5185624.stm (BBC)]</ref> * 25 Lebanese are killed in [[Israeli Air Force]] strikes in southern Lebanon.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5185624.stm (BBC)], [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3276932,00.html (Ynet)], [http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/E821E46B-A4DA-46B9-8FD5-FE461210664B.htm Al-Jazeera], [http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738699.html (Haaretz)]</ref> Among the dead were seven Canadians, with six other Canadians critically wounded.<ref name="Canadian Family Dies in Attack">{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com/NASApp/cs/ContentServer?pagename=thestar/Layout/Article_Type1&c=Article&cid=1153087815519&call_pageid=968332188492&col=968793972154|title= Canadian Family Dies in Attack | work=The Star | location=Toronto | accessdate=2010-05-25}}</ref> *Air attacks on Beirut's southern suburbs, continued through the day and evening.<ref name="Israel pummels Lebanon after Haifa strike">{{cite news|url=http://www.iht.com/articles/2006/07/16/news/mideast.php|title= Israel pummels Lebanon after Haifa strike}}</ref> {{see also|Haret Hreik}} |}
==17 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''IDF''' * Israeli air strikes targeted a Hezbollah stronghold in Lebanon, which killed 17 combatants. Hezbollah retaliated by firing away Katyusha rockets thirty-five miles south of the Lebanese border, which landed in the northern Israeli town of [[Atlit]]; although, there were no casualties reported.<ref name="Israeli Forces Kill 17 in Lebanon Attacks">{{cite news|url=http://www.thetandd.com/articles/2006/07/17/ap/headlines/d8itkr4g0.txt|title=Israeli Forces Kill 17 in Lebanon Attacks}}</ref> * Some Israeli ground troops briefly entered into Lebanon, its southern portion, with the intent of completing a mission of attacking Hezbollah bases on the border.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wral.com/apworldnews/9526076/detail.html |title=Israel Briefly Sends Troops into Lebanon |date=17 July 2006 |accessdate=2006-07-17 |publisher=[[WRAL-TV]] }}{{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> *At least 10 Lebanese have died in an Israeli attack on their vehicles in the south of the country, sources say.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5188420.stm (BBC NEWS)] *Israel extends its air campaign to northernmost Lebanon, killing at least 14, among them 9 soldiers, after [[Hezbollah]] rockets hit [[Haifa]]. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5186140.stm (BBC)], [http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/738699.html (Haaretz)], [http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/4BA16706-0A31-4524-ACE6-FD3420939327.htm (Al-Jazeera)] *Israel claims to have destroyed a long-range Iranian missile capable of hitting [[Tel Aviv]] in an airstrike on Lebanon. [http://www.indiadaily.com/breaking_news/75704.asp (India Daily)] |- |'''United Nations''' / '''United Kingdom''' * U.N. ==24 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''United States''' * [[Condoleezza Rice]] proposed a first ambitious plan in which international military forces would help the Lebanese government stabilize southern Lebanon, Lebanese political sources said. The plan would involve putting an international force of up to 10,000 Turkish and Egyptian troops under a [[NATO]] or U.N. commander into southern Lebanon following a cease-fire, the Lebanese political sources said. Another international force of up to 30,000 troops then would help the Lebanese government regain control over the region, the sources said. Rice presented the plan to Lebanese officials, the sources said, and will show it to European foreign ministers 26 July in Rome, Italy. U.S. and diplomatic sources said Lebanese officials are leaking details of the proposal because they are opposed to many of them. The sources describe the plan as an outline or working proposal and said no one has agreed to it. They also said there are many hurdles to overcome before it could be implemented.<ref name=CNN-07-25>{{cite news|title=U.N.: Israeli airstrike hits U.N. observer post|date=25 July 2006|publisher=CNN|url=http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/25/mideast.main/index.html}}</ref> |- |'''IDF''' * Israel has used artillery-fired cluster munitions in populated areas of Lebanon, Human Rights Watch said. Researchers on the ground in Lebanon confirmed that a cluster munitions attack on the village of [[Blida]] on 19 July killed one and wounded at least 12 civilians, including seven children. [[Human Rights Watch]] researchers also photographed cluster munitions in the arsenal of Israeli artillery teams on the Israel-Lebanon border. "Cluster munitions are unacceptably inaccurate and unreliable weapons when used around civilians," said [[Kenneth Roth]], executive director of Human Rights Watch. "They should never be used in populated areas." |}

"I assume that it will go on for a few more weeks", he said. The goal, according to the IDF, is to push Hezbollah guerrillas away from the border and reduce the Islamic militia's capability to launch Katyusha rockets into northern Israel.<ref name="CNN-07-26"/> |- |'''Lebanon''' * Since 12 July, at least 398 people—mostly civilians—have been killed in Israeli strikes, Lebanese sources say. The fighting also has wounded more than 1,400 in Lebanon.<ref name="CNN-07-26"/> |- |'''United States''' * Talks in Rome, Italy, floundered after the United States disagreed with European and Arab nations over how to defuse the situation, according to sources in Washington, D.C. and [[Jerusalem]]. The United States has resisted demands for an immediate cease-fire, insisting that a cessation of hostilities must be part of a wider plan to permanently disarm Hezbollah. Arab and European leaders say the violence must stop first. Meanwhile, Israel, which was not invited to participate in the talks, said it hoped "the international community will act immediately to strengthen the Lebanese army" so the army can take charge of southern Lebanon after the talks.<ref name="CNN-07-26"/> |}
==27 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''Lebanon''' [[File:South Lebanon refugee.jpg|thumb|Lebanese refugees in south Lebanon on 27 July]] *Lebanon's Prime Minister [[Fouad Siniora]] proposes a [[Siniora Plan|peace-plan]] at the 15-nation conference in Rome on 27 July. * Since 12 July, at least 405 people—mostly civilians—have been killed in Israeli strikes, Lebanese security sources said. ==28 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''Hezbollah''' *Hezbollah fires a new rocket, the [[Khaibar-1]] at [[Afula]].<ref>[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,206033,00.html "Israel, Hezbollah Continue to Trade Attacks"], ''[[Fox News Channel|Fox News]]'', 28 July 2006</ref> Three missiles carrying 100 kilograms (220 pounds) each of explosives—nearly five-times the explosives in the standard Hezbollah missile, the Katyusha rocket—were fired toward the town of [[Afula]], the police said.<ref name="CNN-07-28" /> Powerful maybe like a Fajr-5 rocket.<ref name="IMEMC & Agencies">{{cite news | title=Army shells several areas in southern Lebanon | date=29 July 2006| publisher=[[IMEMC & Agencies]]| url= http://www.imemc.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=20437&Itemid=173}}</ref> Afula is 44 miles southeast of [[Haifa]] and is just a few miles north of the [[West Bank]]. Furthermore, Iran's state news agency confirmed Hezbollah Secretary General [[Hassan Nasrallah]]'s presence in Damascus. Although Hezbollah has received significant Iranian assistance in the past, Iranian officials denied assisting Hezbollah in the current conflict.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1153292020585&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull|title=Iran denies giving aid to Hizbullah|date=28 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-28|publisher=[[Jerusalem POst]]}}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> *[[Hezbollah]] leader [[Hassan Nasrallah]] was reported to have taken refuge in the Iranian Embassy in [[Beirut]].<ref>[http://www.washtimes.com/national/20060728-123022-5852r.htm (Washington-Times)]</ref> |- |'''Israel''' * Israeli officials said that 51 Israelis—33 soldiers and 19 civilians—have died and 1,233 Israelis—110 soldiers and 1,123 civilians—have been wounded in the fighting began between Hezbollah forces and Israel. "Israel is going to do it at our own pace, at our own time, to make sure that when we go in, we go in carefully, and that we don't walk into their booby traps", Israeli government spokeswoman [[Miri Eisin]] said. "We want to stop the rocket fire, but we also want to make sure that Hezbollah will not be there afterward." Since Israel left Lebanon in 2000, Hezbollah has built up the area around [[Bint Jbeil]] in southern Lebanon, according to Eisin. They want us to walk into those booby traps."<ref name="CNN-07-28"/> * In Israel, there was disagreement between [[Mossad]] intelligence which says Hezbollah will be able to continue fighting at the current level for a long time and military intelligence which believes Hezbollah has been severely damaged.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/743736.html|title=IAF takes out launcher used to fire missiles at Afula area|date=28 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-28|work=[[Haaretz]]}}</ref> Other scholars have also questioned the Israeli reliance on air power.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.brookings.edu/views/op-ed/gordon/20060725.htm|title=Israel against Hezbollah: Air Power Won't Do It|date=25 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-25|publisher=[[Brookings Institution]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060726032204/http://www.brookings.edu/views/op-ed/gordon/20060725.htm|archivedate=26 July 2006|df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- |'''United Nations''' * Aid agencies say they are finding it impossible to get food and medicines safely into the region. The United States also evacuated about 500 more Americans from Beirut on a cruise ship, the AP said. About 15,000 U.S. citizens have left the war-torn country, according to the AP.<ref name="CNN-07-28"/> *Six people are shot, one fatally, at the [[Seattle Jewish Center]] in a [[July 2006 Seattle Jewish Center shooting|religiously-motivated killing spree]]. The killer identified himself as a [[Muslim]] American who was angry over about the [[2006 Israel-Lebanon conflict]].<ref>[http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/S/SEATTLE_SHOOTING?SITE=7219&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2006-07-28-20-03-32 (Associated Press)]{{dead link|date=July 2016 |bot=Cyberbot II |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> ** The [[White House]] has dismissed UK concerns about the use of [[Prestwick Airport]], in Scotland, by United States planes carrying bombs to Israel.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/5221782.stm (BBC NEWS)]</ref> |- |'''European Union''' * The [[European Union]] said it had finished evacuating most of its 20,000 citizens from Lebanon, according to the [[Associated Press]]. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5223940.stm (BBC News)] [http://euobserver.com/9/22177 (EUobserver)]. |- |'''IDF''' * So far, only the officers of the three divisions of reserves, authorized 27 August, have put on their uniforms and begun to train for possible military action, military sources said. Shelling was also conducted on [[Sour]] in addition to areas in [[Beqaa Valley|Al Biqa]] plains, 14 Lebanese fatalities were reported.<ref name="IMEMC & Agencies"/> * Lebanese officials reported that Israel conducted over 130 air raids (killing 13) while an Israeli police spokesman said that Hezbollah fired 97 rockets into Northern Israel (wounding 3).<ref>{{cite news|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/20236FF4-957C-4761-B57F-F61EFFCE6705.htm|title=Hezbollah strikes deep into Israel|date=28 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-28|publisher=[[Al Jazeera]]}}</ref> |}
==29 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''IDF''' *IDF withdraws from the town of [[Bint Jbeil]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/world/4080960.html|title=Israelis pull back from Hezbollah target|agency=Associated Press|date=14 July 2006|accessdate=2006-07-29}}</ref> And were searching for pockets of resistance.<ref name=CNN-07-29>{{cite news|title=Source: Islamic Jihad leader killed |date=29 July 2006 |publisher=CNN |url=http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/29/mideast.main/index.html |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060819033321/http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/29/mideast.main/index.html |archivedate=19 August 2006 }}</ref> Thus it was the end of the [[Battle of Bint Jbeil]]. 8 Israeli soldiers and 50–70 [[Hezbollah]] militants were killed in Bint Jbeil.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/743736.html (Haaretz)],[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3283102,00.html (Ynet)]</ref> * Israel Defense Forces killed two [[Islamic Jihad Movement in Palestine|Islamic Jihad]] militants in the [[West Bank]], one of whom was the head of the group's military wing, according to Palestinian sources. The IDF did not confirm the report, but said that a gunman was killed in a gunfight near [[Nablus]]. The deaths come the day after the IDF reported that it had arrested 22 "wanted Palestinians" in the West Bank on 27 July. Two Israeli airstrikes prompted the main border crossing between Lebanon and Syria to close, Lebanese army sources said. Israeli strikes have already left roads leading to the crossing badly damaged.<ref name="CNN-07-29" /> * There were IDF missile attacks around the area of [[Al Safeer]], in the Al Dahia Al Janoubiyya area of Beirut, and shelling of the Jarhou' area in southern Lebanon. North of Beirut IDF shelling destroyed the [[Al Assy Bridge]]. Shelling attacks were also made against Jabal Abu Rashid, Borka, Jbour and Al Nahry in Al Biqa plains. Sahl Al Khiyam, in Marj Oyoun area, in southern Lebanon were also shelled with artillery as well as Al Tayba and Markaba villages. The area around Sour city and outlying villages was also shelled. An IDF spokeswoman said that the IDF had attacked 51 targets overnight and at dawn, destroying 37 buildings used by Hezbollah.<ref name="IMEMC & Agencies"/> The [[Israeli Air Force]] carried out 60 airstrikes overnight on Hezbollah locations and structures as assaults between the Lebanese militant group and the Israeli military entered their 18th day, the Israel Defense Forces said. Targets struck by the IDF were located chiefly in southern Lebanon and included 37 Hezbollah warehouses and locations, roads, bridges and cars, the IDF said.<ref name="CNN-07-28"/> |- |'''United Nations''' * Diplomatic efforts to halt the violence in Lebanon continued in [[Jerusalem]]. U.S. Secretary of State [[Condoleezza Rice]] dined with Israeli Prime Minister [[Ehud Olmert]] at night, according to the U.S. Embassy in [[Tel Aviv]]. Hours earlier, Israel rejected a U.N. call for a three-day cease-fire. It has not been announced if Rice would travel to Beirut to meet with Lebanese Prime Minister Fouad Siniora, and Rice has said she doesn't plan on taking a comprehensive proposal to the region. "I don't expect to present somebody with a 'here are the five points you must accept,' " she said. "This has got to be some give and take. This is difficult." U.S. officials and diplomatic sources involved in the negotiations said Rice's goal is to merge various proposals for ending the fighting into a comprehensive package agreed to by Israel and Lebanon and enshrined in a United Nations resolution. The U.S.-endorsed plan would require Lebanon to deploy its army with the help of an international peacekeeping force and agree to call for Hezbollah to disarm, with its military wing ultimately integrating into the Lebanese army. This would all need to happen before an official cease-fire could be declared. In return, Israel would resolve the issue of the disputed [[Shebaa Farms]] territory with Lebanon.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> * The U.N. Security Council will begin debating a resolution this week spelling out the way ahead. Later in the week, 3 August, Rice will attend a ministerial meeting of council members to finalize language on the text. Rice said she has only read news reports about the Lebanese government proposal—to which Hezbollah had agreed in principle with some reservations—but it appeared to have "some very good elements." She called it a "positive step." France circulated a draft [[United Nations Security Council|U.N. Security Council]] resolution calling for an immediate cessation of hostilities in the Mideast and laying the foundation for the deployment of a multi-national force aimed at supporting the Lebanese army in disarming Hezbollah, according to diplomatic sources.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> * The United Nations' appeal for the cease-fire came from its emergency relief coordinator [[Jan Egeland]] "so that we can evacuate wounded, evacuate children, evacuate the elderly and the disabled from the crossfire in Lebanon." A third of the people killed in Lebanon have been children, he said.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> * Two U.N. peacekeepers from the Indian battalion were wounded at afternoon when an aerial bomb detonated near them in south Lebanon, said a spokesman for the U.N. Interim Force in Lebanon. Their observation tower was damaged, UNIFIL added. UNIFIL had earlier reported Israeli and Hezbollah fire near its positions on both sides of the border and said it "strongly protested all these incidents to the Israeli and Lebanese authorities." An Israeli attack on another U.N. observation post killed four U.N. observers 25 July.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> |- |'''Hezbollah''' * Hezbollah has said it will not disarm until Israeli troops leave the disputed region near the Syrian border, which the U.N. recognizes as Syrian territory. Hezbollah leader [[Hassan Nasrallah]] said, in a speech aired on his group's Al-Manar TV station, that Israel had been counting on a victory to secure a political solution but has failed. "It's clear ... that the Zionist enemy has not been able to reach a military victory. I'm not saying that. They said that. The whole world is saying that", he said. Nasrallah also said Rice's return to the region was to impose the will of the United States on the Middle East. "Rice comes back to the region to try to impose its conditions again on Lebanon – serving in its new Middle East and serving Israel", he said.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> *[[Hezbollah]] head [[Hassan Nasrallah]] vows rocket strikes on towns in central Israel, calling it a "temporary country" and asking "When in any Arab-Israeli conflict were two million Israelis forced to flee or enter bomb shelters?" [http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/744031.html (Haaretz)], [http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3283155,00.html (Ynet)] * As of 3:30 p.m. (8:30 am. ET), 39 rockets had landed in northern Israel, six inside the cities of Acre, [[Tiberias]], [[Nahariya]] and [[Safed]], wounding five people.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> |- |'''Lebanon''' * Since 12 July, Lebanese Internal Security Forces said that 421 people have been killed and 1,661 have been wounded in Lebanon. A Turkish warship with dialysis equipment arrived at the Port of Beirut, as did a U.S. warship with blankets, tarpaulins and medical equipment.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> |- |'''Israel''' * In Israel, 52 people have been killed, more than half of them soldiers, and more than 1,200 have been wounded, according to Israeli officials.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> * Israeli government spokesman [[Avi Pazner]] said Israel rejects a temporary cease-fire for getting civilians out of southern Lebanon. "There is no need for a 72-hour temporary cease-fire because Israel has opened a humanitarian corridor to and from Lebanon", Pazner told reporters.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> |- |'''United States''' * The U.S. plan is similar to one proposed this week by Siniora and endorsed 28 July by his Cabinet, including the Hezbollah ministers. Siniora's proposal includes strengthening the existing [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] in south Lebanon and deploying the Lebanese army to the area. Both plans call for Israel to agree on a prisoner exchange for the release of the Israelis soldiers kidnapped by Hezbollah and to resolve the issue of the disputed Shebaa Farms territory. But two major sticking points remain. Lebanon, as well as Arab and European states say a cease-fire must take place before the rest of the deal can be implemented, while the U.S. and Israel insist the force must be in place, the Lebanese army must be deployed and efforts must be under way to disarm Hezbollah before an official cease-fire can be declared. The composition and mandate of the international force is also a thorny issue. The U.S. and Israel would prefer a European force, while Lebanon wants to expand the existing UNIFIL force. And it remains unclear whether the force would have the authority to fight against Hezbollah.<ref name="CNN-07-29"/> |}
==30 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" | '''Israel''' * Israeli Prime Minister [[Ehud Olmert]]'s office told Rice that Israel needed 10 to 14 more days to complete its mission against Hezbollah militia.<ref name=CNN-07-30>{{cite news|title=Israel halts airstrikes for 48 hours|date=30 July 2006|publisher=CNN|url=http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/30/mideast.main/index.html}}</ref> '''IDF''' *[[Israeli Air Force|IAF]] airstrike of a three-story building in [[Qana]], [[Southern Lebanon]], kills 28 people, including 16 children, hiding in its bombshelter. 13 people were reported missing.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.hrw.org/english/docs/2006/08/02/lebano13899.htm|title=Israel/Lebanon: Qana Death Toll at 28 August 2, 2006 Human Rights Watch|date=2 August 2006|accessdate=2006-08-02}}</ref> As a result, Israel announces its intention to severely restrict further airstrikes for a 48-hour period beginning 2 am 31 July 2006. Bush]] said the United States is resolved to work with members of the Security Council to draw up "a resolution that will enable the region to have a sustainable peace", he said.<ref name="CNN-07-30"/> |- |'''UN''' * The [[UN Security Council]] is to hold an emergency meeting on the Lebanon crisis after the deaths of more than 54 Lebanese civilians in an Israeli raid.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5229058.stm (BBC)]</ref>

==31 July==
{| style="width:100%;" class="wikitable" |- |'''IDF''' * Israel Air Force continues airstrikes in support of ground forces in southern Lebanon, but refrains from attacks elsewhere in accordance with its stated 48-hour period of restraint. *The Israeli military and Hezbollah forces started engagement in the town of Ayta al-Sha'b in southern Lebanon. {{see also|Battle of Ayta al-Sha`b}} * Reuters, quoting Israel Radio, reported 15,000 reservists would be called up, but it is not clear whether those troops are the ones already authorized or extra troops. Clashes with Hezbollah have left 33 Israeli troops dead, IDF said. Hezbollah's casualties were not known.<ref name=CNN-07-31>{{cite news|title=Israel OKs expansion of Lebanon campaign|date=31 July 2006|publisher=CNN|url=http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/31/mideast.main/index.html}}</ref> * The Israeli army said strikes near the Lebanese village of [[Tayibe (Lebanon)|Tayba]] were meant to protect ground forces operating in the border area and were not aimed at specific targets. The Israeli military expressed regret that one of the strikes hit a Lebanese military vehicle outside [[Tyre, Lebanon|Tyre]], Lebanon. The Israel Defense Forces said it was unclear how many people were killed. Earlier, a senior Lebanese Interior Ministry official said the airstrike killed an aide to a Lebanese general and wounded three soldiers. The general survived the attack, the official said. The IDF said it thought the car was carrying a senior Hezbollah militant involved in directing rocket fire on Israel. Earlier, the IDF said its aircraft fired on open fields surrounding its ground forces in the Tayba area. Three Israeli soldiers in the area suffered minor injuries after Hezbollah fighters hit their tank with a missile, an Israeli army spokesman said.<ref name="CNN-07-31" /> The towns of Al-Awayda area, Kafr Shuba' and Kafr Hamam were also hit with IDF artillery strikes.<ref name="AP">{{cite news | title = Israeli strikes resume after brief lull|date=31 July 2006| publisher=[[Houston Chronicle]]|url= http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/ap/world/4083393.html}}</ref> |- |'''Hezbollah''' * Hezbollah also holds its fire, with "the Israeli Army counting only three mortar shells landing in Israel ... and no rockets."<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2006/08/01/world/middleeast/01mideast.html "Israel Pushes On Despite Agreeing to Airstrike Lull"], ''[[New York Times]]'', 1 August 2006</ref> at least three in [[Haifa]], wounding six people. * Hezbollah's [[Al-Manar]] television station claimed Hezbollah missiles hit an Israeli warship. An Israeli security source said no Israeli vessel had been hit, according to Reuters news service. Reuters also reported that Hezbollah said the attack was retaliation for 30 August bombing of [[Qana]], Lebanon, that killed at least 54 civilians. The airstrike—which killed many children and sparked international outrage—threatened to derail work toward a resolution in the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah guerrillas.<ref name="CNN-07-31" /> * Two Hezbollah rockets hit in an open area of the northern Israeli town of [[Kiryat Shmona]], but no casualties were reported, Israeli police officials said. The firings marked the first Hezbollah rocket attacks into northern Israel from southern Lebanon in a day. Hezbollah has responded by firing scores of rockets a day into northern Israel, killing at least 18 Israeli civilians, according to IDF.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> |- |'''United Nations''' * At the United Nations, a Security Council meeting on planning for a new peacekeeping force had been delayed "until there is more political clarity" on the path ahead in the Middle East conflict, Reuters news agency reported. U.N. Secretary-General [[Kofi Annan]] had called the meeting 28 July, but the world's major powers have said no force can be put in place until fighting stops and Israel, Lebanon and Hezbollah agree to its deployment, Reuters reported.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> * Teams from the [[Red Cross]] and United Nations arrived in the southern Lebanese town of [[Bint Jbeil]] to survey the damage and evacuate residents, a day after heavy fighting reduced much of the area to rubble.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> * The [[UN Security Council]] has expressed its "shock and distress" at the previous day's Israeli attack in which 54 Lebanese [[civilians]], many of them children, were killed.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5229058.stm (BBC NEWS)]</ref> |- |'''United States''' * President [[George W. Bush|Bush]] said there could be no cease-fire until Hezbollah was reined in and international borders respected, reiterating the U.S. stance on the conflict. Bush, speaking in Florida, said Israel had the right to defend itself and called on Iran and Syria to stop aiding Hezbollah. "Iran must end its financial support and supply of weapons to terrorist groups like Hezbollah", Bush said. "Syria must end its support for terror and respect the sovereignty of Lebanon." U.S. Secretary of State [[Condoleezza Rice]], speaking earlier, said she believed a resolution to the crisis could be reached this week.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> |- |'''Israel''' * Israel has called the Qana airstrike a tragic mistake, and [[Ehud Olmert]] apologized for the pain the Lebanese people have endured. But he added, "We are fighting terrorists who know no bounds." In his speech today, he said Hezbollah has suffered a "heavy blow" in the fighting. Israeli troops and airstrikes have inflicted serious damage to Hezbollah's capacity to launch rockets into Israel, and its supply routes from Syria have been hampered, he said. "We will stop the war when the [rocket] threat is removed ..., our captive soldiers return home in peace, and you are able to live in safety and security." "We are paying a very precious and almost unbearable price in terms of loss of life, major damage to public and private property and tranquility – and we're not prepared to give up our right to live perfectly ordinary lives, which are not subject to terrorism and hate and fanaticism", Olmert said.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> * [[Dan Gillerman]], the Israeli ambassador to the United Nations, said he was "not really worried" by today's Syrian declaration.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> * Israeli Defence MinisterAmir Peretz]] has said that, despite a 48-hour halt to air strikes on [[south Lebanon]], Israel cannot agree to an immediate [[ceasefire]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5230192.stm (BBC NEWS)]</ref> * In New York, Olmert's deputy, [[Shimon Peres]], said Israel's problem is with Hezbollah's Syrian and Iranian backers, not Lebanon. "Though Hezbollah is a Lebanese body, they don't serve any Lebanese purpose", he said. Their purpose, he said, is to "make Lebanon part of the sphere of influence of Iran."<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> |- |'''Syria''' * Syrian President [[Bashar al-Assad]] directed his country's military to heighten its readiness, vowing to back Lebanese resistance against Israel, the state news agency SANA reported.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> |- |'''Lebanon''' * Israeli airstrikes and artillery have pounded Lebanon since then, leaving nearly 500 people dead, Lebanese Internal Security Forces said.<ref name="CNN-07-31"/> |}
